intro: Cousinia maassoumii, commonly known as the Maassoumii globemallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its spherical, woolly seed heads that give it a unique appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Cousinia maassoumii is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
